page.title: 08REDBOURN HIGH STREET
page.content: {Redbourn High Street}is a part of the old Roman Road called{Watling {Street}.It is now called the{A.5.}It runs from{London}through{St.Albans}in the South to{Dunstable}and beyond in the North. Redbourn was a very important{ {Coaching point}going North from London.Seventy years ago in 1915 Redbourn High Street was a much busier place with lots of different businesses.These are a few of them{ {fellmonger,fishmonger,boot shop and {black smith .} When we surveyed the High Street in June 1985 there were{72 buildings}.Of these 26 were private houses,7 were food{shops}and 19 were non_food shops, chemists,saddlers,haberdashers,and building supplies.There are 4 public houses and 2 restaurants in the{High {Street}.
